viewsWelcome.contents:
$(rocket) Reduce App Size Flutter

Analyze your Flutter project to find dead code, unused resources, and bloated dependencies — then remove them to reduce download size and improve startup performance.

$(symbol-class)  Unused Classes — Dart classes that are declared but never instantiated or referenced anywhere in the project.

$(symbol-method)  Unused Methods — Functions and methods that are defined but never called from any part of the codebase.

$(package)  Unused Packages — Dependencies listed in pubspec.yaml that are never imported in any Dart source file.

$(file-media)  Unused Assets — Images, fonts, and data files registered in pubspec.yaml but not referenced in any code.

[$(play)  Start Analysis](command:deadCodeView.refresh)

---

$(graph)  APK / IPA Size Breakdown

Load a compiled binary to get a detailed breakdown of which components (Dart AOT snapshot, Flutter engine, native libraries, DEX bytecode, assets) are consuming the most space — so you know exactly where to focus your optimization efforts.

[$(package)  Load APK File](command:deadCode.loadApk)

[$(device-mobile)  Load IPA File](command:deadCode.loadIpaFile)

Tip: Re-run the analysis after every major refactor. Even small removals can noticeably reduce your app's install size and improve user acquisition.

$(loading~spin)  Scanning your Flutter project…

Parsing Dart source files and building a reference graph to identify:

• Classes with no instantiation or type references
• Methods and functions that are never called
• Packages in pubspec.yaml missing from all imports
• Assets registered in pubspec.yaml but unused in code

Analysis depth and duration depend on project size. This usually completes within a few seconds.
